page.title: 13WOODLAND IN OUR DISTRICT
page.content: The first{wood}we went to was a private wood on Green Lane North. The area of the wood was 5670 metres square. We measured and estimated the size, most of the trees were {deciduous}but a few were coniferous. There were silver birch, oak, field maple, holly, white poplar, hazel, elderberry and ash. We then went to another wood that was situated in Gt. Plumstead, that wood was private as well. There was a medieval hedgerow running through the wood; the wood covered about three acres. The trees were mainly deciduous. About 50 trees were cut down a year. The{disease}that they had had most was Dutch Elm Disease. The{animals}that lived there mainly were foxes, squirrels, birds, rabbits and pheasants. The woods also contained Beech and Sycamore trees as well as holly and oak.
